intro: Calendula gracilis, commonly known as slender marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Calendula gracilis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, making it a valuable addition to gardens and wildflower habitats.
